movie_title: Britain's love affair with coffee - 6 Minute English
introduction: Here in the UK, when it comes to enjoying a nice hot drink, it's not all about tea. We like coffee t

vocabulary.definition: a substance that increases activity in the body or brain
vocabulary.example: Caffeine is a common stimulant found in coffee.

vocabulary.definition: physically and mentally dependent on a particular substance, and unable to stop taking it without adverse effects
vocabulary.example: She realized she was addicted to coffee when she couldn't function without it.

vocabulary.definition: gradually deprive someone of something to which they are addicted or dependent on
vocabulary.example: He decided to wean himself off sugary drinks by switching to water.

vocabulary.definition: a scheme that ensures fair prices are paid to producers in developing countries for their products
vocabulary.example: She prefers to buy Fairtrade coffee to support ethical farming practices.

vocabulary.definition: a small plot of land that specializes in producing high-quality or unique coffee beans
vocabulary.example: This coffee shop prides itself on serving microlot coffee beans from different regions.

vocabulary.definition: relating to or characteristic of an artisan; handcrafted in a traditional way
vocabulary.example: The artisanal chocolate was made with care and attention to detail.
